heroTitle: Agent systems designed for narrow, measurable roles.
heroLede: Tutor agents, interview agents, and a growing catalog share the same role-boundary-evaluation spine. This page details fit, use, and limits.
overviewCopy: Every agent: defined inputs, explicit outputs, scoped boundaries, and evaluation loops with escalation.
excelCopy: Structured work that benefits from repeatability, auditability, and governed scaling—not open-ended chat.
tutorCopy: Structured, subject-specific learning companions. They run scoped drills, track progress, and deliver measurable learning at scale.
tutorNote: Use when teams need repeatable learning, assessments, and reinforcement—not open-ended Q&A.
interviewCopy: Conduct structured interviews with constraints, role-specific checklists, and scoring logic to standardize evaluations.
interviewNote: Use when consistency, audit trails, and bias reduction are critical to decisions.
futureCopy: A growing catalog: onboarding coaches, QA reviewers, operations copilots. Built on the same framework for quick, governable launches.
futureNote: Use when a narrow role needs repeatable decisions with clear guardrails.
whenTutor: Tutor Agents: when teams need repeatable learning with progress tracking and scoped drills.
whenInterview: Interview Agents: when decisions depend on consistent questioning, scoring, and auditability.
whenFuture: Future Specialized Agents: when a focused role is needed for onboarding, QA, or operations support.
fitCopy: Each agent is defined by a role, a boundary, and an evaluation loop. New roles inherit the same guardrails.
useTutorGood: Skill ramp, onboarding cohorts, policy refreshers.
useTutorLimit: Not for unbounded brainstorming or replacing instructors; keep scope narrow.
useInterviewGood: Discovery calls, audits, qualitative research with consistent prompts.
useInterviewLimit: Not for final hiring decisions; humans own judgment and escalation.
useFutureGood: Process QA, policy compliance checks, routine operational reviews.
useFutureLimit: Avoid ambiguous authority; boundaries and approvals remain explicit.
tutorRole: Guide, drill, and assess within defined subject boundaries.
tutorEvaluation: Mastery checkpoints, score deltas, adherence to scope.
interviewInputs: Role to assess, question bank, scoring rubric.
interviewRole: Conduct structured interviews with constraints and checklists.
interviewEvaluation: Calibration checks, bias checks, rubric adherence.
